snippet: Conservative donors, including those who once encouraged Gov. Chris Christie to seek the White House, say the governor’s style has driven them to support others.
abstract: Republican strategists reveal growing party frustration with New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, who they describe as having an inflated impression of his prominence in the field for the 2016 presidential nomination; donors and key supporters are either flirting with or committing to rival candidates, saying Christie has come to reside in a bubble of close-knit advisers, ignoring how his tone and behavior have hurt his national image.

byline.original: By MAGGIE HABERMAN and NICHOLAS CONFESSORE
byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro and Trip Gabriel contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Conservative donors, including those who once encouraged Gov. Chris Christie to seek the White House, say the governor’s style has driven them to support others.

headline.main: Critics in G.O.P. Say Chris Christie Is in a ‘Bubble’
headline.print_headline: Critics in Party View Christie as in ‘Bubble’
